questions.context: As quoted in Spandau: The Secret Diaries, Albert Speer, New York, NY, Pocket Books (1977) p. 84
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: To the defense forces: The Polish nation has refused my efforts for a peaceful regulation of neighborly relationsl instead it has appealed to weapons.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: reported 1 September 1939 (the full proclamation available via the TimesMachine ) in The New York Times "Hitler Gives Word" special cable from Otto D. T...
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: We are going to destroy the Jews. They are not going to get away with what they did on 9 November 1918. The day of reckoning has come.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: To the Czechoslovakian foreign minister (January 21, 1939) quoted in Sarah Ann Gordon, Hitler, Germans, and the "Jewish Question" pg. 130
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: We do not want a war merely for the purpose of bringing to Germany people who simply do not want to be, or cannot be, Germans.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: Broadcast (27 May 1933), quoted in The Times (26 September 1939), p. 9
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: We do not wish to interfere with the rights of others, to restrict the lives of other peoples, to oppress or subjugate other people.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: Speech in Lippe (14 January 1934), quoted in The Times (26 September 1939), p. 9
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: We want this people to be hard, not soft, and you must steel yourselves for it in your youth!
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: Source listed on Wikiquote compilation.
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: We want to be a peace-loving element among the nations. We cannot repeat that often enough.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: Speech in Berlin (30 January 1936), quoted in The Times (26 September 1939), p. 9
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: You will never learn what I am thinking. And those who boast most loudly that they know my thought, to such people I lie even more.
questions.speaker: Adolf Hitler
questions.context: Statement to Franz Halder, as quoted in The Psychopathic God (1993) by Robert George Leeson Waite, p. xi
questions.theme: H. Loyalty, purity, and mass manipulation

questions.quote: The American people are with you!

questions.context: In an emailed statement " Trump urges GOP senators to vote against McConnell debt deal " (October 7,2021)

questions.quote: The Jews always flip.

questions.quote: I refuse to accept other people's ideas of happiness for me. As if there's a "one size fits all" standard for happiness
